phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

processinfo.head: Preservation Note
processinfo.p: Footage related to this title was received as unfinished trims, in a series of separate rolls. It has been compiled and placed on a core for stability in storage. Each length of footage is separated by blank film leader to clearly indicate the the beginning and end of each trim.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Receipts, correspondence, notes, and documents. The documents in this file predominantly relate to either to obtaining rights to the music used in "The Dorothy Series" video or to the sale of the videos and slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, drafts of voice over. Includes both English and French versions of the voice over text for the Dorothy Series video and slides.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The slides are organized following Wayne's organizational method of separating works by medium and sometimes by series. Within folders, the slides are generally arranged chronologically. However, Wayne had her own system of organizing the slides of her prints, which she called "Gilmour" numbers. These numbers were created by Pat Gilmour in preparation for a catalogue of Wayne's works.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series contains Wayne's professional slide collection. It predominantly consists of slides of her work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes various lists of the slides as well as a list of people with whom Wayne corresponded.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 223 color slides and 2 lists. Includes slides of lithographs and collages created by June Wayne. This folder also includes two lists of slides in what is referred to as Gilmour order and alphabetically. The Gilmour order numbering system derives from the numbering system used by Pat Gilmour in her volume, "June Wayne: Lithographs" published in 1989. See also folders for the Dorothy Series. Some slides were missing from Wayne's studio collection when the items were processed for the archives. When these items are available elsewhere in the collection, it is indicated within the folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 206 color slides. Includes slides of lithographs and collages created by June Wayne. See also folders for the Dorothy Series. Some slides were missing from Wayne's studio collection when the items were processed for the archives. When these items are available elsewhere in the collection, it is indicated within the folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 55 color slides. Includes slides of the lithographs and colophon for the Stellar Winds series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 201 color slides. Includes slides of the lithographs and colophon for the Dorothy series including details and title slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 10 color slides. Includes slides of the lithographs and colophon for the My Palomar series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 7 color slides. Includes slides from the Solar Flares colophon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 26 color slides. Includes the slides of 13 tapestries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 128 color slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 31 color slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 163 color slides. "June Wayne" at the Art Center of La Jolla, "Lithographs by June Wayne: A Retrospective" at the Cincinnati Art Museum, "Made in California: an Exhibition of Five Workshops" at the Grunewald Graphic Arts Foundation, "June Wayne: an Exhibition of Paintings, Tapestries, and Lithographs" at the Los Angeles Municipal Gallery in Barnsdall Park, an installation of prints from the Donne series at the University of Washington library, "Wind, Waves, Visas: Tapestries, Paintings, Lithographs" at the Artemisia Gallery in Chicago, "Tapestries and Lithographs by June Wayne" at Cypress College Fine Arts Gallery, tapestry installations at the Transamerica Pyramid in San Francisco, "June Wayne: The Djuna Set" at the Montgomery Art Gallery of Pomona College, "June Wayne: A Retrospective" at the Palm Springs Desert Museum and LACMA. The folder also includes installation shots of the genetic code series installed in Wayne's home and studio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 265 color slides. Includes slides from various professional photo shoots. Includes slides photographed during the KCET tapings of the June Wayne show and during Wayne's time spent as visiting artist at the University of Texas, Austin. Photographers credited for the slides include Julius Shulman, Kenneth Rogers, and Bernard Nagler.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 35 color slides. All slides are portraits of Wayne. Photographer Kenna Love credited for some of the slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 69 color slides.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 8 color slides. Includes Wayne's watermark and chop as well as the Tamarind Workshop chop.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 13 color slides. Slides show interior spaces of the Tamarind Workshop as well as various artists and printers working in the studio.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 70 color slides. Slides feature the work of artists who trained or visited the Tamarind Workshop. Artists represented are: Clinton Adams, Garo Antreasian, Ruth Asawa, Kengiro Azuma, Herbert Bayer, William Brice, Jose Luis Cuevas, Richard Diebenkorn, Sam Francis, Francoise Gilot, Leon Golub, John Grillo, Philip Guston, Richard Hunt, Alfred Jensen, Ynez Johnston, Allen Jones, John Paul Jones, Matsumi Kanemitsu, James Kelly, Rico Lebrun, Jacques Lipchitz, Frank Lobdell, James McGarrell, Lee Mullican, Nathan Oliveira, George Ortman, Jesse Reichek, James Strombotne, George Sugarman, Joyce Treiman, Kenneth Tyler, Emerson, Woelffer, Paul Wunderlich, and Adja Yunkers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 154 color slides, 11 4x5" negatives. Slides appear to be from a presentation by Wayne. Most slides are numbered though many slides were assigned multiple or conflicting numbers. Slides feature the Los Angeles area, the Tamarind Workshop, many of Wayne's colleagues, as well as Wayne's work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 20 color slides. Slides feature images of the planets and the Voyager 2 craft.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 2 booklets with 36 slides in each. Booklets were portfolios to be sent to galleries, museums, and potential buyers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 6 slides. Includes images of Wayne's "Thou Shalt Not", Francoise Gilot's "The Dream", and Charles White's "Love Letter."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 16 slide pairs. Objects in this folder were intended to be viewed through a special view finder in order to give a three-dimensional illusion to the image. The images on these slides are of the Wayne home at Londonderry and of Robin Wayne's birthday party. For 3-D slide viewer, see box 126, folder 14.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Color filmstrips. Filmstrips include sets of Wayne's work generally taken from a series such as My Palomar, Stellar Winds, or A Day Off.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 1 3-D slide viewer. The viewer gives the allusion of a three dimensional space when double slides are placed inside. To use with 3-D slides, see box 142, folder 13.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Lists. List that indicates which slides may be missing from the Broken Stones set.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The series is organized into seven subseries: Prints; Print Suites; Paintings; Drawings: Collages: Tapestries: and Digital Files. The order of the series follows the order Wayne used in her studio, dividing the art work by medium and, in the case of prints, by suite. Within each subseries, artwork is arranged, if available, by suite, and then alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The photographs in these series were used to send to galleries and buyers. Most of the photographs in this series are 8x10" black and white prints or 5x7" color transparencies, though other formats and negatives are included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes photographs of lithographs and etchings made by Wayne that were not included in a set.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 10 8x10" photographs. Includes photographs of artwork by the following artists: Philip Guston, Ynez Johnston, John Paul Jones, Rico LeBraun, Louise Nevelson, Nathan Oliveira, Henry Pearson, Adja Yunkers. See also slides of Tamarind artists' prints, box 142, folder 8.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 3 8x10" negatives, 2 8x10" photographs, 2 2x3" installation shots. Includes images of Adam En Attente and Eve en Attente, as well as installation shots of the two works together.

scopecontent.p: This subseries includes CDs and DVDs that contain images of Wayne's art works.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To access digital materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 7 compact discs, 12 contact sheets.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This addition was processed in July 2012 by Jasmine Jones for the Center for Primary Research and Training with assistance by Jillian Cuellar.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series has kept its original order, devised by Wayne.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This series includes drafts and reprints of articles, speeches, and essays written by Wayne. Also included are short stories Wayne had written early in her career as an artist, as well as transcripts of interviews given by Wayne, one of which is most notably the transcripts of a UCLA oral history interview.
